items.title: No web UI login page after TRAINS server installation (0.16.0)
items.body:
I have installed the TRAINS server version 0.16.0 on a newly build Linux server. Previously I was using 0.15.1, and it was working with no issues. However, the new installation has no login page. The only page has example projects and experiments.
I followed the Trains Server Troubleshooting section "Why is web login authentication not working?" but it didn't solve the issue.
Below is the `apiserver.log`.

items.title: logger.report_text fails
items.body:
I am trying to follow Explicit Reporting tutorial. How ever, when trying to run `pytorch_mnist_tutorial.py` it fails on the following line:

```
    logger.report_text('The default output destination for model snapshots and artifacts is: {}'.format(model_snapshots_path), level=logging.DEBUG)
```
logger was initialized via `logger = task.get_logger()` without any errors.

items.title: UI Error: Unable to create credentials
items.body:
Hi 👋 I'm trying the on-prem/server deployment for trains through docker-compose and am getting a `Unable to create credentials` error when trying to customize my configuration through trains-init. Where would be a good place for me to start to debug this?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13604961/90451874-0fa8bc00-e0aa-11ea-97a5-e2277f272da8.png)

items.title: New version noticed displayed after update
items.body:
I just completed the update to version 0.16.0 following the instructions for data migration and then pulling a new docker-compose.yml file, etc. No errors were displayed during the process, the "Renaming the source directory..." message was displayed. After that, when accessing the web portal the message: "A newer version of trains-server ( 0.16.0) is available" is still being displayed. Is that expected or did I miss a step of the update process? Thank you!

BTW: there seems to be a broken link in "contributing guidelines": please check whether the bug you want to report already appears [here](link to issues

items.title: Links from Getting Started Tutorial are broken
items.body:
https://allegro.ai/blog/setting-up-allegro-ai-platform/
It seems that examples are moved and some links became broken. See:
>Trains has got you covered (https://github.com/allegroai/trains/blob/master/examples/hyper_parameters_example.py)

>as well as storing general purpose artifacts (https://github.com/allegroai/trains/blob/master/examples/artifacts_toy.py)

items.title: tracking on train\val loss function in real time
items.body:
Hi,
I`m trying to visualize the train\val loss function in real time. currently I print every epoch the metrics. here is my code:

`
print(f'Epoch {e + 0:03}:'
              f' | Train Loss: {train_epoch_loss / len(train_loader):.5f} |'
              f' Val Loss: {val_epoch_loss / len(val_loader):.5f} |'
              f' Train Acc: {train_epoch_acc / len(train_loader):.3f}|'
              f' Val Acc: {val_epoch_acc / len(val_loader):.3f} |'
              f' Train F_score: {train_epoch_f_score / len(train_loader):.3f}|'
              f' Val F_score: {val_epoch_f_score / len(val_loader):.3f}')
`

items.title: task.execute_remotely should update task state
items.body:
Currently, 

`task.execute_remotely("default", False, True)` will send the task to the queue without updating its state. The function will reset the task and enqueue it, then exit the current process. Therefore in the web UI, the task is shown as completed and stays in that state, even if the task was picked by an agent and is being executed remotely.

task.execute_remotely should do something like:

```
def execute_remotely(self, queue_name=None, clone=False, exit_process=True):
        ....
        # leave this process.
        if exit_process:
            LoggerRoot.get_base_logger().warning('Terminating local execution process')
            self.mark_stopped()  # <--- We explicitly mark the task as stopped
            exit(0)
```

Currently, to get the correct behavior, I have to do:

```
        if Task.running_locally():
            task.mark_stopped()  # Make sure task is mark as stopped so that its state is correctly switched to "pending" afterwards
            task.execute_remotely(queue_name="default")
        # Now running in agent
        ...
```

items.title: Task.enqueue raises TypeError with default parameters
items.body:
With `trains==0.15.0rc0`

When calling `Task.enqueue(task)`, user gets the following error:

```  
File "piping.py", line 47, in main
    Task.enqueue(task)
  File "/Users/h4dr1en/miniconda3/envs/training-py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/task.py", line 710, in enqueue
    req = queues.GetAllRequest(name=exact_match_regex(queue_name), only_fields=["id"])
  File "/Users/h4dr1en/miniconda3/envs/training-py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/backend_interface/util.py", line 125, in exact_match_regex
    return '^%s$' % re.escape(name)
  File "/Users/h4dr1en/miniconda3/envs/training-py36/lib/python3.6/re.py", line 267, in escape
    for c in pattern:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
```

This is because both `queue_name` and `queue_id` were not specified when calling `Task.enqueue(task)`. Nevertheless:
- The error is not straightfoward (should raise `ValueError("No queue_id/queue_name specified")`)
- `Task.enqueue` should not have `queue=None`(User should not expect a function to fail because of default values). Either:
    1. Set default value of `queue_name` to "default" (which would make a lot of sense). `queue_id` should only be considered if it is not `None` and should take the predecence over `queue_name`.
    2. Change signature: `Task.enqueue(task, queue)`, where `queue` is either an id or an name. The detection of whether `queue` is a name or an id can be done under the hood.

items.title: Multitask pipeline: how?
items.body:
Hi, first of all thanks for the amazing job 👍 

## Context

I usually wrap my training scripts inside a python package (say `ml-engine`). This allows me to introduce a CLI for the package, with several endpoints, say:
- `ml-engine train [OPTIONS]`
- `ml-engine valid [OPTIONS]`
- `ml-engine infer [OPTIONS]`
- `ml-engine convert [OPTIONS]`

Typically, each command has its own dependencies requirements and I create a specific conda environment for each one of them. I can then easily install the `ml-engine` thanks to its `extra_require` property defined in its `setup.py`:

```
setup(...,
    extra_require= {"train": [torch=1.0.0], 
                              "valid": [torch=0.4.0], 
                              "infer": [onnx=1.0.0],
                              "convert": [onnx==1.1.0]})
```

I am considering moving to `trains`, but I would need to solve the following problem:

## Problem

I define one experiment by a series of ordered steps, as follows (pseudo-code):

```
#/bin/sh
conda activate train-env
ml-engine train [OPTIONS]
conda activate valid-env
ml-engine valid [OPTIONS]
conda activate convert-env
ml-engine convert [OPTIONS]
```

In `trains`, I would therefore need to have either:
- an experiment that is able to switch between different envs (logic executed inside the agent). Probably the agent is not designed to do such a thing, but I could simply create the new envs I need within the script and switch between then. However this sounds ugly.
- 3 different experiments, of the same project/name, with 3 different environments. This definitely seems to be in the scope of what is explained in the [task-pipelining](https://allegro.ai/docs/examples/examples_tasks/#task-pipelining) section of the doc. I would the need a controller Task that would schedule the `train`, `valid` and `convert` tasks one after the others, passing the parameters from one task to the next one. Is it possible? Is it a valid use-case of the task-pipelining? (Was it meant to be used this way?)

I would be glad to know your opinion on how to fit this use-case in `trains` 👍

items.title: Async model checkpoint upload fails when the file is renamed
items.body:
### Bug
While using `TrainsLogger` in Pytorch-Lightning, the latter saves model checkpoint via `_atomic_save` function, which renames the file right after calling `torch.save`. Consequently, train's hook on `torch.save` tries to asynchronously upload `.ckpt.part` file and fails.

The original issue on Pytorch-Lightning Github: https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/issues/1466

items.title: pkg messages breaks doctests
items.body:
We have some problems with Trains pushing messages via `sys.stdout` instead commonly used `sys.stderr`. The case is with doctests where the output is compared to the expected value and with just minor package update a message text change it breaks our tests like this example:
```
064         >>> logger.log_metrics({"val_loss": 1.23}, step=0)
Expected nothing
Got:
    TRAINS new version available: upgrade to v0.14.1rc2 is recommended!
```
a simples solution on our side is to freeze version but it would limit Trains users so I would appreciate to change the streaming channel or be able to configure it
https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/pull/1087/checks?check_run_id=532067360

items.title: subparser issue with remote execution
items.body:
Hello trains team,

I have some issues when using argparse with subparser and running script remotely with trains-agent. [Here](https://github.com/elinep/trains_issue_argparse_subparser) is a small repo to reproduce the problem.

I have a script with global parameters and subparser parameters all set to default integer value 1.
```
from argparse import ArgumentParser
from trains import Task

def build_parser():
    parser = ArgumentParser()
    parser.add_argument("--global_param0", type=int, default=1)
    parser.add_argument("--global_param1", default=int(1))

    sub_program_subparser = parser.add_subparsers(dest="sub_program")
    program_subparser = sub_program_subparser.add_parser("program")
    program_subparser.add_argument('--specific_param0', type=int, default=1)
    program_subparser.add_argument('--specific_param1', default=int(1))
    return parser

if __name__ == '__main__':
    # create task
    task = Task.init(project_name='argparser_issue', task_name='test')
    # set manualy requirements, auto detection will timeout
    task._update_requirements("trains")

    parser = build_parser()
    args = parser.parse_args()
    print("parsed arguments:")
    print(args)
```

I can run this script locally and override all my default parameters like this.
```
python script.py --global_param0 2 --global_param1 2 program --specific_param0 2 --specific_param1 2
```
which behaves as expected and outputs
```
parsed arguments:
Namespace(global_param0=2, global_param1='2', specific_param0=2, specific_param1='2', sub_program='program')
```
[remote experiment link on demo server](https://demoapp.trains.allegro.ai/projects/5536614fa22443e1a01113cc38eedf81/experiments/7270c5a3905e4186acc08f9b499749ca/execution)


Now I clone the task on the web interface and run it in a remote fashion. 
```
trains-agent execute --id ID_OF_THE_CLONE_TASK
```
which doesn't behave like the local run. Some arguments are missing and types are not consistent.
```
parsed arguments:
Namespace(global_param0=2, global_param1=2.0, specific_param1=2.0, sub_program='program')
```
[remote experiment link on demo server](https://demoapp.trains.allegro.ai/projects/5536614fa22443e1a01113cc38eedf81/experiments/83b78b91bdfc4623b6e789e8d19ecca7/info-output/log)

Next table summarizes the result and the expected behavior

| params          | expected  | local run | remote run |
|-----------------|:---------:|:---------:|:----------:|
| global_param0   |     2     |     2     |      2     |
| global_param1   |    '2'    |    '2'    |     2.0    |
| sub_program     | 'program' | 'program' |  'program' |
| specific_param0 |     2     |     2     |            |
| specific_param1 |    '2'    |    '2'    |     2.0    |
 
There are 2 issues:
- (minor) when the type is not set the remote run doesn't behave like argparse ('global_param1' and 'specific_param1').
- for remote execution, sub parser arguments are not set when the type is specified as an int.

I want to be able to choose which columns to compare, or to just have the configuration as it is now (compare all columns).
It will be good to have this flexibility.

Thank you

items.title: Unstable connection causes training to freeze
items.body:
Hi,
I tried to use TRAINS (v0.10.7) in an environment with an unstable connection to the internet.
While getting a lot of 'retrying to connect' messages, my training steps are being delayed (or stop).

I tried to set the following configuration in `/trains/backend_api/config/default/api.conf`, to minimize the amount of those kind of messages:
```
http {
        max_req_size = 15728640  # request size limit (smaller than that configured in api server)

        retries {
            # retry values (int, 0 means fail on first retry)
            total: 0     # Total number of retries to allow. Takes precedence over other counts.
            connect: 0   # How many times to retry on connection-related errors (never reached server)
            read: 0      # How many times to retry on read errors (waiting for server)
            redirect: 0  # How many redirects to perform (HTTP response with a status code 301, 302, 303, 307 or 308)
            status: 0   # How many times to retry on bad status codes

            # backoff parameters
            # timeout between retries is min({backoff_max}, {backoff factor} * (2 ^ ({number of total retries} - 1))
            backoff_factor: 1000.0
            backoff_max: 1.0
        }

        wait_on_maintenance_forever: false

        pool_maxsize: 512
        pool_connections: 512
    }
```

After cutting off the internet connection in the middle of a training, it froze completely with an infinitely repeating message: `Failed logging task to backend (1 lines)`.

Is there a workaround for working offline (in which TRAINS will completely stop reporting), or at least one that won't interfere with the training steps (without freeze or delay)?

items.title: model_from_json behaves differently after trains is loaded
items.body:
This piece of code behaves differently before/after connecting to trains:
```
        from keras import models
        from keras.applications.resnet50 import ResNet50
        model = ResNet50(weights=None)
        json_string = model.to_json()
        model = models.model_from_json(json_string)
        print(type(model))
        return
```

It returns a model with type `keras.engine.network.Network` object, but it should return a `keras.engine.training.Model`, as it does when trains is not loaded.

items.title: FileNotFoundError occurs when I load pretrained model
items.body:
Hi,
I'm using PyTorch+TRAINS with single calling on the top of codes.

I load pretrained model manually with following code:
```python
state_dict = torch.load(
    path, # pathlib.Path 
    map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage
)
```

Then, TRAINS make unexpected behavior like below:
```
  File "/home/ubuntu/work/xxxx/xxxx/xxxx.py", line 50, in __init__
    map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/__init__.py", line 25, in _inner_patch
    raise ex
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/__init__.py", line 23, in _inner_patch
    ret = patched_fn(original_fn, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/trains/binding/frameworks/pytorch_bind.py", line 92, in _load
    model = original_fn(filename or f, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/torch/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 382, in load
    f = open(f, 'rb')
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'xxxx.pth'
```

It seems TRAINS automatically detects something and tries to load pth file with a wrong path.
Please give some descriptions about this behavior?
As I don't currently want any more functionality, I want to make it off if I can.
